info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 10:47PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 1046 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Margate, moving southeast at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Broadview-Pompano Park, Lazy Lake, North Andrews Gardens, Terra Mar, Oakland Park, Village Park, Wilton Manors, Lauderdale Lakes, Twin Lakes, North Pompano Beach, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Tamarac, Ramblewood East, Palm Aire, Pompano Beach Airport, Margate, Sea Ranch Lakes, and North Lauderdale.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
